meanings.definition: A curb or enclosure around a well to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent1: The wellcurb around the village well keeps everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: The old wellcurb was made of sturdy wood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the wellcurb but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the stone wellcurb, filling the quiet square.
meanings.sent5: The bright red wellcurb stood out against the green grass, a beacon of safety.

meanings.definition: To enclose or protect a well with a curb.
meanings.sent1: The workers will wellcurb the new well to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: They decided to wellcurb the well after the incident.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the wellcurb was a magical barrier against monsters.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a wellcurb, protecting her from harm.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to wellcurb the well, ensuring everyone's safety.
